definitions.definition: A blow ; a punch ; a striking against; the collision of one body against another; the stroke that touches anything.
Something very successful, such as a song , film , or video game , that receives widespread recognition and acclaim .
A blow; a calamitous or damaging occurrence.
examples: His reputation took a hit when the new information came to light.

definitions.definition: An attack on a location, person or people.
A collision of a projectile with the target .

subdefinitions.definition: In the game of Battleship , a correct guess at where one's opponent ship is.

definitions.definition: A match found by searching a computer system or search engine
A measured visit to a web site , a request for a single file from a web server.
examples: My site received twice as many hits after being listed in a search engine .

definitions.definition: An approximately correct answer in a test set .
The complete play, when the batter reaches base without the benefit of a walk , error , or fielder’s choice.
examples: The catcher got a hit to lead off the fifth.

definitions.definition: A dose of an illegal or addictive drug.
examples: Where am I going to get my next hit ?

definitions.definition: A premeditated murder done for criminal or political purposes.
A peculiarly apt expression or turn of thought; a phrase which hits the mark.
A move that throws one of the opponent's men back to the entering point.
A game won after the adversary has removed some of his men. It counts for less than a gammon .

main_definition: A blow ; a punch ; a striking against; the collision of one body against another; the stroke that touches anything.
secondary_definitions: Something very successful, such as a song , film , or video game , that receives widespread recognition and acclaim .
( figuratively ) A blow; a calamitous or damaging occurrence.
An attack on a location, person or people.
A collision of a projectile with the target .
( computing , Internet ) A match found by searching a computer system or search engine
( Internet ) A measured visit to a web site , a request for a single file from a web server.
An approximately correct answer in a test set .
( baseball ) The complete play, when the batter reaches base without the benefit of a walk , error , or fielder’s choice.
( colloquial ) A dose of an illegal or addictive drug.
A premeditated murder done for criminal or political purposes.
( dated ) A peculiarly apt expression or turn of thought; a phrase which hits the mark.
( backgammon ) A move that throws one of the opponent's men back to the entering point.
( backgammon ) A game won after the adversary has removed some of his men. It counts for less than a gammon .
